Sentencas: The sluggish oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) greatly reduces the energy efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: A robust and active hybrid catalyst for facile oxygen reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Here we report our findings in dramatically enhancing the ORR kinetics and durability of the state-of-the-art La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3 (LSCF) cathode using a hybrid catalyst coating composed of a conformal PrNi0.5Mn0.5O3 (PNM) thin film with exsoluted PrOx nanoparticles.
Titulo: A robust and active hybrid catalyst for facile oxygen reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At 750 degrees C, the hybrid catalyst-coated LSCF cathode shows a polarization resistance of B-0.022 Omega cm(2), about 1/6 of that for a bare LSCF cathode (B-0.134 Omega cm(2)).
Titulo: A robust and active hybrid catalyst for facile oxygen reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Further, anode-supported cells with the hybrid catalyst-coated LSCF cathode demonstrate remarkable peak power densities (B1.21 W cm(-2)) while maintaining excellent durability (0.7 V for B500 h).
Titulo: A robust and active hybrid catalyst for facile oxygen reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Near Ambient X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS) and Near Edge X-Ray Absorption Fine Structure (NEXAFS) analyses, together with density functional theory (DFT) calculations, indicate that the oxygen-vacancy-rich surfaces of the PrOx nanoparticles greatly accelerate the rate of electron transfer in the ORR whereas the thin PNM film facilitates rapid oxide-ion transport while drastically enhancing the surface stability of the LSCF electrode.
Titulo: A robust and active hybrid catalyst for facile oxygen reduction in solid oxide fuel cells
